title: Mechanism to extend console command for Quarkus dev running
body:
### Description

Current, when run Quarkus application with Quarkus:dev profile, we saw several built-in console command like below.

The following commands are currently available:
== Completed Application

[ ] - Restarts the application
[e] - Edits the command line parameters and restarts ()

== Continuous Testing

[r] - Resume testing
[o] - Toggle test output (disabled)

== HTTP

[w] - Open the application in a browser
[d] - Open the Dev UI in a browser

== System

[s] - Force restart
[i] - Toggle instrumentation based reload (disabled)
[l] - Toggle live reload (enabled)
[j] - Toggle log levels (INFO)
[h] - Shows this help
[q] - Quits the application

So, it could be good if Quarkus could provide the mechanism that allow application add more console command based on application's demand.

The following commands are currently available:
== Completed Application

[ ] - Restarts the application
[e] - Edits the command line parameters and restarts ()

== Continuous Testing

[r] - Resume testing
[o] - Toggle test output (disabled)

== HTTP

[w] - Open the application in a browser
[d] - Open the Dev UI in a browser

== System

[s] - Force restart
[i] - Toggle instrumentation based reload (disabled)
[l] - Toggle live reload (enabled)
[j] - Toggle log levels (INFO)
[h] - Shows this help
[q] - Quits the application

== Custom App 
[k] custom console command


### Configuration suggestion

_No response_

### Additional context

As I tried to add this below source as on main thread :
ConsoleStateManager.ConsoleContext consoleContext = ConsoleStateManager.INSTANCE.createContext("New");
 
I saw that it create another instance ( INSTANCE ) of ConsoleStateManager object, so I could not add to current as well as built-in console commands.
